intro: Osteophloeum platyspermum, commonly known as the broad-seeded osteophloeum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many members of its family. It is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
